DOC.brief_summary: This study is designed to assess the efficacy of a flexible dose regimen of fesoterodine on micturition related nocturnal urgency episodes.
DOC.brief_title: A Trial To Evaluate The Efficacy And Safety Of Fesoterodine In Patients With Symptoms Of Overactive Bladder Including Nocturnal Urinary Urgency
DOC.criteria: Mean urinary frequency of >=8 micturitions per 24 hours as verified by the screening bladder diary prior to Start of Placebo run in visit (Visit 2) Mean number of micturition related urgency episodes >=3 per 24 hours as verified by the screening bladder diary prior to Start of Placebo run in /Visit 2 (Urgency episodes are defined as those with Urinary Sensation Scale rating >=3) Mean number of micturition related nocturnal urgency episodes >=2 but no more than 8 episodes per 24 hours as verified by the bladder diary at Visit 2 (nocturnal urgency episodes are defined as those with Urinary Sensation Scale rating of >3 recorded in the bed time section of the bladder diary) A known recent history or previous diagnosis of any sleep disorder such as obstructive sleep apnea, primary insomnia, periodic limb movement, parasomnia Nocturia due to other underlying uncontrolled conditions, such as congestive heart failure, diabetes mellitus, diabetes insipidus, polyuria of any cause, etc.
